channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2025050422
item.description:
Report E-2025050422

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-15
  • City: WASHINGTON
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR RANGER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On May 15, 2025, at 1215 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Washington, MO regarding the release of Ethanol. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 275.0 gallons of Ethanol (UN1170, 3, II) from (1) 270-gal poy tote and (1) 5-gal plastic pail onto asphalt and the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to a load shift as the tote slid into a pallet, impacting the trailer floor and a 1’ x 2’ area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Damaged pails of product were overpacked in a flex bin by the contractors to leave with the consignee and send back to the shipper. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DGs which were taken off-site by the contractor pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050311
item.description:
Report X-2025050311

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-04
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Forklift driver punctured 1 tote when moving freight. Maree Montoya, 120/ABQ Operations Supervisor, reported 330 Gallons from 1 tote spilled on dock floor due to a forklift operator puncturing the tote. A crew from Environmental Restoration arrived. Crews placed absorbent pads and absorbent booms t o contain the release on the loading dock. Environmental Restoration personnel utilized a shop-vac to collect freestanding liquid throughout the release site. Environmental Restoration personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized a s hop-vac to transfer the remaining contents of the damaged tote into 55-gallon drums. All alcoholic beverage-impacted material was collected and containerized in five (5) 55-gallon drums and staged on-site for further management. ER personnel noted no further actions required on-site and crews demobi lized.

item.title: Report E-2025050153
item.description:
Report E-2025050153

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: FOSTORIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On 05/02/2025, at 16:35 hours, personnel in the CSXT Fostoria, Ohio Yard discovered SIRX525280, a loaded hopper car of Ferrous Sulfate, leaking from the A-end slide gate. The car was isolated and the shipper, SEM Minerals, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-05-02-00202). SPSI, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the A-end slide gate open approximately 1-2” and spilling product. Contractor personnel applied plugging material to the slide gate door to secure the leak, as it could not be closed full. The issue was identified, and corrective actions, were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Keith Mizwicki).

item.title: Report E-2025050088
item.description:
Report E-2025050088

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: HINESVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS USA, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50223
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 07:30 AM Eastern Time the Airgas National Carbonation driver was stopped at a RailRoad Crossing in Hinesville GA when she was rear ended by a third party driving a Red Bull delivery truck. There is damage to the the ANC vehicle #308713 to the extent that it will need to be towed, and the damage to our truck has caused the tank to leak. At this moment the ANC driver is saying she is not injured but HV Care has been contacted as a precaution. The driver of the Red Bull vehicle is saying he is not injured.
